title: Confidence Women: Gender, Empowerment, and Entrepreneurial Mythmaking in the Wellness MLM Industry
authors: Regele, Matthew D. and Schakenbach Regele, Lindsay
description: We examine how empowerment and confidence narratives mobilize identity and effort among women in wellness-oriented multi-level marketing businesses, while masking unit economics and converting structural constraints into personal shortcomings.

title: Confidence Women: The Role of Dance Fitness Entrepreneurs and Workers in Multi-Level Marketing History
authors: Schakenbach Regele, Lindsay and Regele, Matthew D.
description: We trace the evolution of dance-fitness and wellness MLMs such as Jazzercise, Zumba, Shine, and Turn Up, showing how compensation design and community-based customer acquisition coevolved with shifts in women's work and social media.

title: Riding the Line: Legitimacy Ambidexterity in Outlaw Motorcycle Clubs
authors: Regele, Matthew D. and Lippmann, Stephen
description: A conceptual paper developing a theory of how organizations alternate between norm violation and norm compliance to build internal cohesion and external influence, with implications for new ventures and scaling firms.

title: How Entrepreneurs Conceptualize the Value of Education for Entrepreneurship
authors: Humphrey, Jarrod, Regele, Matthew D., and Gaddis Ross, David
description: A textual analysis of Reddit posts examining how nascent entrepreneurs encounter and construct narratives about university-based entrepreneurship education in online communities.

title: Structuring Flexibility: Intensity, Choice, and Outcomes for Adult Learners
authors: Regele, Matthew D., Helsinger, Abigail, Woodruff, Sarah, Dixon, Maressa, and Cummins, Phyllis
description: Part of a $1.4M IES-funded project studying how technical education programs structure flexibility for adult learners and how program design affects student outcomes.

title: Helping Me or Helping You? Motivation and the Continuous Deployment of Managerial Capital in Developing Country SMEs
description: A study examining the motivations behind ongoing managerial support to small and medium enterprises in developing economies.

title: Employer Relationships and Student Success in Ohio's Technical Centers
authors: Dixon, Maressa and Regele, Matthew D.
description: Research examining how employer-institution partnerships shape student outcomes in Ohio's technical education centers.

title: Lowering Barriers to Postsecondary Education Success for Marginalized Adult Learners
authors: Woodruff, Sarah, Helsinger, Abigail, Regele, Matthew D., Dixon, Maressa
description: A study identifying structural barriers to postsecondary success and translating evidence into actionable program design for underserved populations.
